timeline.message: add more test cases to improve branch coverage

timeline.bodyText: Please rename this e to ignored.
timeline.author: asdf2014

timeline.bodyText: This instance of MockJedisPool is useless, please delete it.
timeline.author: asdf2014

timeline.bodyText: I believe that port should be passed in instead of host.
timeline.author: asdf2014

replies.bodyText: host here contains the host name and port. I think the variable name is a little bit ambiguous, it should be changed to hostAndPort to make it clear.
replies.author: FrankChen021

timeline.bodyText: There is still a difference between connectionTimeout and soTimeout. If possible, please extend the soTimeout parameter.
timeline.author: asdf2014

replies.bodyText:
Yes, connection timeout and read timeout are different. But

the internal implementation of Jedis takes timeout for both connection timeout and read timeout.
the widely used Spring Redis also provides only one configurable timeout parameter for both connection timeout and read timeout.

So, currently I think it's acceptable to use one properties for both two parameters. I will update the doc to clarify that timeout property is for both connecting and reading.
replies.author: FrankChen021

timeline.bodyText: We need to pay attention to security and avoid exposing password information. For example, we can consider adding @JsonIgnore annotation.
timeline.author: asdf2014

timeline.bodyText: The second judgment should be to avoid the lack of port. For example, 127.0.0.1:. I think it should be changed to index == host.length() - 1 instead of index == host.length().
timeline.author: asdf2014

replies.bodyText:
If port is not provided, the following substring call returns an empty string which causes the parseInt throw NumberFormatException.
There's a test case guarding this edge case whose name will be renamed to testClusterLackOfPort to be more clear in the following commit.
replies.author: FrankChen021

replies.bodyText: Emm.. The maximum value returned by the String#indexOf method is String#length - 1, which makes the second judgment condition index == host.length() meaningless. In addition, judging by normal program logic is clearer and more efficient than judging by throwing an exception.
replies.author: asdf2014

timeline.bodyText: Emm.. Generally, we don't recommend using Sets.newHashSet to create HashSet instances, and we hope to create them directly through new. In addition, it may be more appropriate to use Collections.singleton here.
timeline.author: asdf2014

timeline.bodyText: Let's use the existing tool method here: StringUtils.encodeBase64String.
timeline.author: asdf2014
